output.conclusion: This Calculus course provides a solid foundation for further studies in mathematics, physics, engineering, and other related fields. By mastering the concepts and techniques presented, you will be well-equipped to tackle more advanced problems and applications.
output.introduction: Welcome to Calculus! This course is designed for intermediate-level learners who have a basic understanding of algebra and trigonometry. We will explore the fundamental concepts of calculus, including limits, derivatives, and integrals, and their applications.

chapters.description: Explore the concept of limits and how they form the foundation of calculus. Learn about graphical and numerical approaches to finding limits.
Master algebraic techniques for evaluating limits, including factoring, rationalizing, and using limit laws.
Understand one-sided limits and their relationship to continuity. Learn about different types of discontinuities.
Introduce the concept of the derivative as the slope of a tangent line. Learn different notations for the derivative.
Master the power rule, constant multiple rule, sum/difference rule, and other basic differentiation rules.
Learn how to differentiate trigonometric functions such as sine, cosine, tangent, and their inverses.
Learn the chain rule for differentiating composite functions and apply it to various examples.
Understand implicit differentiation and use it to find derivatives of implicitly defined functions.
Solve related rates problems involving rates of change of related quantities.
Introduce the concept of the indefinite integral as the antiderivative of a function. Learn basic integration rules.
Define the definite integral as the area under a curve. Learn about Riemann sums and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Master the technique of u-substitution for evaluating integrals.
